instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: this macbook this macbook has white screens, I tested with good screen, problem persists, memory ram good, slots ram good, not video external.not usb activity.I only have ram memory, fan and screen connected what measurements do i do?

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: Does it chime?

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: not chime.

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: try flashing bios first

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: not

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: Reset SMC and PRAM, see if it chimes

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: no reset pram, yes reset smc, persist problem

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
Put back original BIOS.
If pure white, missing 3v at TFT matrix.
Voltage at pins 2/3 of J9000?
If no voltage, check L9004 first.

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
Are these measurements l9004 and pins 2/3 with the screen connected?
you have bios original functional?

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
Do NOT touch the BIOS again; write back the original.

Of course, LCD must be connected when measure there.

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: excuse me, I don't understand " Do NOT touch the BIOS again; write back the original"  what do you mean "write back the original"? It refers to erase bios that it has and write another file good of the same board reference?

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: You don't have a BIOS problem; original board BIOS is good, put it back.

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: you say make an original bios copy, erase and write same file again in chip

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
Sorry, didn't pay full atentiuon to first post.
I just saw you've said no USB activity, nor external video.
Very strange to get backlight in this case.

Post CPU core voltage after 10s.
Try one good RAM module at time, each slot separately.

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
Vcore=0.78v l7520,l7510 with module ram good each slot separately
flash bios?

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message:
With 0.78V board boots.
Are you sure there is no USB activity?
Did you check both ports?
If yes, try BIOS...

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: yes both ports, you have file bios good for this board

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: [URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IOFCJ4xJPzjcywY867UE23yfRe_fm9UB/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3115 b screen white
threads.message: yes it is bios, you are genius!!
